page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY-WELL (cont.)
page.content: Mr. Milne, Mr. Walker, Mr. Coles, Mr. Whitton. Mr. Wands, the local plumber, connected the well to the school water supply and Joe, a retired builder, put whinstones and setts around the base of the well. Environmental Health tested the water from the well and said it was suitable for drinking. These wells were manufactured in {Kilmarnock},by{Glenfield and Kennedy. We visited{North Queensferry}to see a similar well at the foot of the 'brae'. It was painted green and yellow. Another well was discovered at {Newton of Falkland,}by one of yhe pupils, Andrew Cooper. It looked in the same conditions as ours, before we restored it. The well is now part of our school badge. In September 1985, one of our parents, Mrs. Kenney, painted a scene showing life as it would have been when the well was used
